lines.content: * Represents a Deadline task that extends the {@link Task} class.
* A Deadline task has a name and a deadline by which it must be completed.

*

For example, a Deadline task might look like:
* The task would be considered a Deadline task with the name "Submit report" and a deadline of "2025-02-10".

*

This class provides a method to return a string representation of the task in the format:
* Initializes a new Deadline instance with the specified name and deadline.
* @param name The name of the Deadline task.
* @param deadline The deadline of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return The string representation of the Deadline task.
* Thrown when a task description is empty.
* Represents an Event task that extends the {@link Task} class.
* An Event task has a name, a start time, and an end time.

*

For example, an Event task might look like:
* The task would be considered an Event task with the name "Team Meeting", a start time of "2025-02-05 10:00"

*

This class provides a method to return a string representation of the task in the format:
* Initializes a new Event instance with the specified name, start time, and end time.
* @param name The name of the Event task.
* @param start The start time of the event.
* @param end The end time of the event.
Event(String name, String start, String end) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* @return The string representation of the Event task.
* Thrown when an invalid command is entered.
* Parses commands to create different task types (ToDo, Deadline, Event) or extract task-related information.

*

This class handles parsing of various task-related commands, such as "todo", "deadline", and "event",
* and converting them into corresponding task objects. It also provides utilities to extract task indices and
* format or parse date information from command strings.

*

For example, parsing a command like "event Meeting /from 2025-02-10 0900 /to 2025-02-10 1100" will return
* an Event task object with start and end times.
* Initializes a new Parser instance with the specified command.
* @param command The command in a String.
* Parses a date string into a LocalDateTime object.
* @param input The date string to parse.
* Formats a LocalDateTime object into a string.
* @param date The LocalDateTime object to format.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy HH:mm");
* Extracts the index of the task to delete from the command.
* @return The index of the task to delete.
* Parses the command and creates a new task to add.
* @throws Exception If the command is invalid or the task description is empty.
* The main class for the Simba task management application.
* Simba manages tasks, allows users to add, view, and delete tasks, and saves them to a file.
* It interacts with the user through the command line interface.

*

Simba integrates with other components such as:

*
  • {@link Storage} - for saving and loading tasks from a file.

*
  • {@link TaskList} - for managing the list of tasks.

*
  • {@link Ui} - for interacting with the user and processing commands.

*

For example, running the application will display a welcome message
* and prompt the user to input commands. Commands
* such as "todo" or "deadline" will be processed and corresponding tasks will be added to the task list.
* Initializes a new Simba instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* The main entry point for the Simba application.
* Runs the Simba application, displaying a welcome message and processing user commands.
* Manages task storage, including reading from and writing to a file.
* The Storage class handles operations related to saving tasks to a file
* and loading tasks from the file.

*
  • Reading task data from a specified file path.

*
  • Writing task data (e.g., task list) to a specified file.

*

For example, a task list can be printed to the console or saved to the file
* by using the methods in this class.
* Initializes a new Storage instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Prints the contents of the file to the console.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the file does not exist.
* Writes the list of tasks to the file.
* @param list The list of tasks to write to the file.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while writing to the file.
* Manages task storage, including reading from and writing to a file.
* The Storage class handles operations related to saving tasks to a file
* and loading tasks from the file.

*
  • Reading task data from a specified file path.

*
  • Writing task data (e.g., task list) to a specified file.

*

For example, a task list can be printed to the console or saved
* to the file by using the methods in this class.
* Initializes a new Task instance with the specified name.
* @param name The name of the task.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The string includes the task's completion status and its name.
* @return A string representing the task, with "[X]" for done tasks and "[ ]" for pending tasks.
* Represents a list of tasks, providing methods to manipulate and manage tasks.
* The TaskList class allows adding, deleting, marking tasks as done or undone,
* and searching for tasks in the list.

*
  • Searching for tasks containing a specific word.
* Initializes a new TaskList instance with the specified list of tasks.
* Deletes a task from the list at the specified index.
* @param idx The index of the task to delete.
System.out.println("\tTask of this number does not exist");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + list.size() + " task(s) in the list");
* Adds a task to the list.
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + list.size() + " task(s) in the list");
* Marks a task as done at the specified index.
* @param idx The index of the task to mark as done.
System.out.println("\tTask of this number does not exist");
System.out.println("\tAlright! This task is done: " + list.get(idx - 1));
* Marks a task as not done at the specified index.
* @param idx The index of the task to mark as not done.
System.out.println("\tTask of this number does not exist");
System.out.println("\tOkay! This task is not done: " + list.get(idx - 1));
System.out.println("\tThere are no matching tasks in the list");
* Represents a ToDo task, which is a type of task that doesn't have a specific deadline or time range.
* Inherits from the Task class and adds functionality to display the task as a ToDo item.
* Initializes a new ToDo instance with the specified name.
* @param name The name of the ToDo task.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task.
* @return The string representation of the ToDo task.
* Represents the User Interface (UI) of the Simba application.
* It handles reading and processing user commands and
* interacting with the storage and task list.
* Initializes a new Ui instance with the specified storage and task list.
* Reads and processes a user command.
* @param command The user command to process.
System.out.println("\tHello! What would you like me to do today?");
System.out.println("\tHere are the list of commands:");
System.out.println("\tOh no! " + e.getMessage() + " description is wrong");
System.out.println("\tOh dear :( I don't understand you");
System.out.println("\tSomething went wrong with the file: " + e.getMessage());
System.out.println("\tPlease refer to the proper command formats");
* Checks if the user has entered the "bye" command.
* @return True if the user has entered the "bye" command, false otherwise.
